oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Coordination complexes based on 4-aminobenzonitrile with different dimensionalities
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NASANI, R
SAHA, M
MOBIN, SM
KIRILLOV, AM
MUKHOPADHYAY, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Self-assembly
Supramolecular chemistry
Coordination polymer
4-Aminobenzonitrile
METAL-ORGANIC FRAMEWORK
MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES

MOLECULAR-STRUCTURES

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reaction of 4-aminobenzonitrile with different transition metal ions in the presence of chloride provides metal complexes of different dimensionalities. Whereas platinum forms a 0-D mononuclear complex {[PtCl2(4-ABN)(2)} 1, three new coordination polymers {[Zn(4-ABN)(2)(H2O)(2)](ClO4)(2)} (n) 2, {[Cu(4-ABN)(2)(MeOH)(2)](ClO4)(2)} (n) 3, and {Cd(4-ABN)Cl-2} (n) 4 have been synthesized and characterized.Complexes 2 and 3 crystallize in 1-D polymeric chains, whereas 4 forms a 3-D coordination network, based on fused 12-membered rings of cadmium and chloride. A topological analysis of 4 reveals a uninodal five-connected network with the point (Schlafli) symbol of (4(4)x6(6)) and the nov (5/4/08) topology. All the isolated complexes were characterized by IR, elemental, and X-ray single crystal structural analyses. Complexes 1, 2, and 4 were additionally characterized by NMR spectroscopy.
